RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIKELY CHOICE engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced a close factor in the four path on the turn then dug in from the head of the lane and got up the final yards. ZUPITA set a pressured pace while tapering to the inside, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn, gave up the lead in the final yards, though, held on for second. TALENTED CORINNA gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and missed the nod in the stretch duel for second. RED PRIESTESS chased through the backstretch, contested at a close disadvantage in the three path while between horses on the turn but flattened stride inside the eighth pol. LONDON GOLD steadied at the break then gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. SASSY BABE chased outside most of the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Zupita
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge rail turn,dug in lane,caught final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Likely Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4p turn,dug in lane,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 88. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE NOVEMBER 17, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIDICULOUS rated just off the pace inside, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep midway on the far turn, raced clear at the eighth pole and was kept sharp in the lane. EKATI'S VERVE settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and came along for second inside the sixteenth pole. CLAW rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn then flattened stride past the eighth pole. PYEONG CHANG saved early ground racing well off the pace, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and showed little in the stretch. BERMONDSEY stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. CAPE LOOKOUT stalked off the rail, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. RAISE A SPEIGHTS lunged at the break and raced in the five path the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the seven path.

ENTRY.NAME: Ridiculous
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Eastham Richard
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside off pace,bid 3/8,up 2d mid turn,clear 1/8,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Claw
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Pyeong Chang
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,5p far turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIGHTNIN QUEEN veered out and made contact with Here's A Quarter leaving the gate then tapered to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, was met entering the stretch but dug in determinedly to eke out the nod over MALIBU YEARS through the stretch. The latter stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole and met the winner at even terms entering the stretch, but was outfinished in a game stretch duel. ROMAN CANDLE rated close inside, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. FLAMME FATALE saved ground off the pace, showed little response through the backstretch and rounded the far turn in the three path. MY LUCKY DEIA stalked the earlier pace from the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the five path on the far turn. POUR ME A DRINK was forced outward leaving the gate, raced in the four path the first turn and never factored. HERE'S A QUARTER was bumped leaving the gate, raced in the five path the opening turn, eased leaving the seven sixteenths pole and walked off post race.

ENTRY.NAME: My Lucky Deia
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Steinmann Eric

ENTRY.NAME: Pour Me a Drink
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Rac es Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: XTENDED STREAK took an immediate lead and tapered to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail and held on under steady handling. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and dueled clear for second later yards. O K SMARTY PANTS chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and relented later yards in the stretch duel for second. VERY VENUS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. MISS ARGENTINA saved ground on the turn, moved to the outside in the upper stretch and could only close the gap. GHOST OF ALCINA gave chase to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Xtended Streak
ENTRY.COMMENT: immediate lead,rated pace,pressured 1/4,rail turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLDEN BLOSSOM dueled to the front leaving the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and held on under steady stretch handling. SK'S HEART gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path, entered the stretch outside and finished well to take second the final yards. PRINCESS MIA ROSE chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. EVERYDAYISAGIFT gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and raced evenly in the lane. SILVER'S GIRL pressured the pace and raced close off the rail on the turn, though, flattened stride later yards. DREAM OF GOLD chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. AFIRE gave chase, raced in the seven path on the turn and flattened in the lane. GREAT SISTERS dueled with a slim early lead then pressured the pace from the three eighths pole, though, faded readily on the turn. EBONY QUEEN gave chase while bearing outward and bolted nearing the turn. A Stewards inquiry was conducted before declaring this race official.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Blossom
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled to lead 3/8,rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Silver's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close off rail turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since October 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARIBBEAN PLEASURE set a pressured pace through the backstretch, drew clear off the rail midway on the turn and held well under steady handling. COMPANY CLOWN engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and cleared second nearing mid-stretch. EL LUCERITO gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch and came along for third later yards. MR TINGLES was hustled along with the early pace but dropped back at the rail midway on the turn and weakened toward mid-stretch. THE ILLUSIONIST gave chase and rounded the turn about the three path. SETTLEMENT DATE saved ground. PRIMAL DESTINY engaged in briefly close early chase but was pulled up leaving the seven sixteenths pole and walked off sore.

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Tingles
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled with pace,dropped back mid turn,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Primal Destiny
ENTRY.OWNER: Fitzpatrick Francis G and Muldoon William

ENTRY.NAME: Caribbean Pleasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,off rail turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since October 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since September 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHAT SAY YOU quickly took over and rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole and contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling and just lasted. HOME SCHOOL stalked inside on the opening turn, raced in the four path the second turn then challenged approaching the three eighths pole, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn and finished well at the outside poll of the winner. PERSONABLE raced in the five path on the first turn then saved ground on the second turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path, angled in at the top of the lane and dug in to take the nod for third. MARK DID IT raced in the six path the opening turn then saved some ground into the second turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. ROYAL PAIN rounded the first turn in the five path and entered the front stretch outside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. SILIPO raced in the four path the first turn and stalked from the seven eighths pole, gave chase approaching the three eighths but faded at the rail on the far turn. URBAN BANDIT stalked the early pace off the rail then faded through the backstretch. THE HAPPY GIANT mostly saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: What Say You
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,edge rail turn,just lasted drving

ENTRY.NAME: Home School
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,4p 2nd turn,challenged 3/8,2d far turn,finish well

ENTRY.NAME: Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 17, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since May 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHERIFF'S KID saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn at the rail, angled to the four path approaching the head of the lane, dug in for the lead past the sixteenth pole and drew away later yards. EXTRA CRUNCHY took the lead toward the three quarter pole and angled to the inside to show the way, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady encouragement, but was caught flattening stride inside the sixteenth pole. ULTIMATE BREEZE saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, was forced out leaving the turn but came along to take third mid-stretch. SULTRY SALLY H stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. SHES SO SPEIGHTSY stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened in the five path on the far turn. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY was roughed off the heels of Shes So Speightsy in the three path entering the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. CASTLE OF CAYLEE settled in the three and four paths the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. KOBE'S GIRL was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Sultry Sally H
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Extra Crunchy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,caught past 1/16
